Recent update: Changed the terms Player-0 and Player-1 to first and second player respectively to avoid confusion. (except at one place where it is necessary, in stub.txt)
This game is now ready for submit.
Recent update: Boss is made tougher. Level1 and 2 are added to create Boss League with same rules.

Updated meta-MCTS. Still hard to say how the game will be solved in the end, with steal. If you had not implemented steal, it would almost certainly have been solved as a win for player 1.

I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
cool game
To make it a possible Puzzle of the Week, consider adding boss league. Boss doesn't have to be strong, just so to filter out random and crashing bots.

Game seems to work fine and is almost ready to publish I think.

Two more things from me:

1) The animation for steal looks cool. However, if you go to next turn really quickly (by pressing on the next frame in the viewer), the animation stops halfway. Not sure how the SDK does these things, but it might be easy to fix. In any case it is not really important. I just thought you might like to know it does this.

2) In the description of steal, you speak of player1 and player0, this is a bit confusing. Maybe say "first player" and "second player". Or maybe someone has a better idea how to describe it.  I understood it perfectly, but that's because I already know what it does. 

You can check here how it is explained in yavalath: https://www.codingame.com/ide/puzzle/yavalath

For now I am going to recommend adding pie rule/swap/steal to this game. Player one seems to have a major advantage when playing most starting moves, except the corner move. These are the results of my meta mcts so far. Corner move being m:0

Nodes created: 647068
m:0 visits:129414 win:46,4% status:2
m:1 visits:129414 win:58,3% status:2
m:2 visits:129413 win:60,1% status:2
m:3 visits:129413 win:70% status:2
m:4 visits:129413 win:61,2% status:2

(I'll keep the result updated)

Steal/swap works as follows: On the first turn player 1 makes a move. player 2 then decides to take over that move or continue playing. When he steals the move, Player 2 gets player 1's color and  let's player 1 move again. That way, the player first to move, has to play a balanced start. It has been implemented here: 

https://www.codingame.com/multiplayer/bot-programming/yavalath

Because of the steal, yavalath is balanced. If it did not have steal, player 1 would always win when playing center (this move is solved). This rule can never hurt a game, aside from the small inconvenience of coding it. Games can only become more balanced with it, not less.

To read more about steal, go here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pie_rule

I'm currently running a meta mcts program to see how much this game favors player 1. I'll leave it running overnight to see the result.

At first glance it seems the game favors player 1 quite a bit.  This may need a fix (there being several options).

I'll let you know.

unlimited message lenght - https://www.codingame.com/replay/519477809
you need to fix that
Found another bug, this one is bigger. If you win the game with the last (63rd) move, the game finishes as a draw. So I am guessing you do your "out of moves" check before the "win check".
I noticed the player message doesn't stay up during the opponents turn. In other games, the player writes a message and it stays up until his next turn.

I like the size at 7x9 because it just barely fits in a 64 bit bitboard and it's not solved apparently. 

I found no bugs so far. Good job.

I'd suggest that you add a league with a not too simple boss (one that beats obvious strategies like "random move" or the more effective "always play first/last move"). 
* it filters out dummy bots which makes the competition more attractive
* it increases your chances to become "Puzzle Of The Week" which is always a dramatic audience boost for a game
Otherwise, your game looks ready for approval. I have not experienced any bugs or crashes
There is a slight bug in the display: when a coin slides in a column, it is not cut properly by the top of the board. It is partly above the top, partly under.

Very cool !!
And an connect 4 for 3 player ??????? ;)

Three major changes:
1. Changed board size from 6x7 to 7x9
2. Added endGameScreen
3. Increased time per turn from 50ms to 100ms

Thanks to darkhorse56 and jrke for feedback.

Git Repository: https://github.com/AshKcg/cg-multi-connect4/tree/master

This is a nice idea to implement this classic game. However, it is solved as a win for White with starting move column 4. It definitely needs some fresh paint.

I suggest that you change the board layout to increase the search space. Either use a larger rectangle (7 x 9 for instance) or change the shape to an octagon (I think it has already been done in another coding site but I cannot find the reference).

On a side note, the graphics are OK but you need an ending screen as a polishing touch.

Thank you very much for the feedback. Both are good ideas.

For the board size, how about this:

* asking the players' bots at the initialization input for rows, cols (with rows < cols)
* and then choosing the minimum of the two choices and 6x7 // any error in bot's output here will be excepted and at such moment 6x7 will be chosen
* and then giving it as input to the players

Reason is that it feels that one can practice search algorithms better in a solved game.

Thanks for commenting jrke. Actually you are the inspiration for me to make this game. I have been wanting to make this game for CG for years and always thought it would be difficult. But you making your game recently inspired me. Thank you very very much.

For the input, I am thinking of keeping it for now, because extensive input may be helpful.
Interesting. Will make a new contribution for 3 player Connect 4.
Thanks for finding it. I did not set the zIndex of the border of the board to be at the top. So, chip is above the border. Will fix it.
Sure, will update the Boss :)
Thanks MSmits. Credits for board size to darkhorse64.
Thanks MSmits for the two bugs. Will fix by today.
Thanks jrke for spotting it for me. You even gave the fixes. Tears of happiness :cry:
Thank you very much.

An easier way is to allow only moves 0 and 8 at first turn. This is likely simpler to implement because it does not change the inputs but is also very commital since you have to trust MSmits results (I do)
Made the explanation for Steal a bit simpler and added images like in yavalath.

Thanks for the reply :). Just after asking the question, I test compiled by deleting Boss.cpp locally, and it was compiling, so, I deleted my comment with the question.
I am waiting if there will be some more feedback after recent changes. :)

I do not see any problems with the game itself. The wall of text that describes the STEAL option is not visually pleasing. If you could insert some lines between paragraphs and diagrams, it would be more readable.
Made it into an unordered list.
Yeah, I did not find a better solution for my own contributions

Not sure what you mean. Player 1 is forced to play move 1, at 53,1% winrate, because if he plays move 3, then player 2 will just steal it and win.

Thanks to steal, the game is more balanced.
Ah my bad thanks now understood
Fixed the animation stopping halfway :)
Looks good :)
Inputs don't change with yavalath's steal rule too, right? Just the color of the chip changes.
I will prefer darkhorse option allow 0 and 8 for first 1or 2 chance
You are right. To steal the move, you just issue the same move than your opponent first turn. No special keyword is needed. The burden is really on the referee side.
If you choose to implement this feature, I am perfectly fine with it. Actually given MSmits statistics, the easiest thing to do is to always steal opponent move in your bot.

actually no, you dont issue the same move, then you're just stacking on top. What you do is allow an output "STEAL" for player 2 on his 1st turn.

EDIT: Also remember that the number of total turns increases by 1 when you do this. So the game now has 64 turns (max) when the first move is stolen and 63 turns (max)  when it is not.

simply if player 2 steals it becomes player 1 so winrate will still be problem so as far as i think its not the solution and by the way when we submit on CG it plays from both side(player1 and player2) so it shouldn't be a big problem

jrke's points seem true. What do you think MSmits?

[New question] Will an even sized board help? (8x8)

Err, I stand corrected. You need a special keyword to steal instead of stacking.

The idea behind the pie rule is that if p1 chooses a very favorable opening move, p2 steals it and p1 is in jeopardy. To avoid a possible loss, p1 has to choose an equal move.
I don't think it can help: 8x8 is solved as a win for p2 (I don't know which are the balanced/bad first moves).
i don't think changing boardsize will balance it it will vary favouring p1 and p2 but as i said CG submits plays from both side so problem in that

jrke you're missing the point of steal. Move 3 has the highest winrate. If you add the steal option, then player 1 will simply never play move 3, because otherwise, player 2 will steal it.

Instead player 1 will play a worse move, like move 0. Then if player 2 steals it, the game is still balanced.

Steal wil always help balance, because player 1 is forced to start with the most balanced move. It's very much possible that this move is solved as a draw.

Also, lack of balance is a huge problem. You're right that CG submits from both sides, but what will happen is that with a sufficiently unbalanced game, the top bots will simply always win as player 1. Then it doesnt really matter anymore which bot is the strongest. Your bot could be stronger than mine, but i would still always beat you as p1.

Even if CG offered the option to play two games with the same opponent (one as p1, one as p2), which it does not, it would not really solve the matter of unbalanced games: you would simply get a lot of draws.
Bandas is a fairly good example: some games are lost from turn 1 (I mean my mcts tells me that I start with 30% winning chances), except against weak bots because of unbalance. That said, this multi is a very good exercise for bitboarding.
Starting with equal chances will more effectively help comparing bot strengths.
Also with 8x8, if it is solved as a win for p2, then all starting moves of player 1 are bad and none will be stolen. So 8x8 is a terrible choice.

I am now convinced for Steal :)

Second player will be able to output STEAL for the first time.

First player will then get "-1" as opponent's move for the second time (as -1 is sent in the first turn too for the first player).
me too convinced for Steal i will say make it -1 for first turn and -2 for second if opponent stealed.
Sure.
if (turn index == 3 && opponent action == -1) then steal occurred
As turn index starts from 0, and jrke asked to make steal -2, if (turn index == 2 && opponent action == -2) then steal occurred

My point was to show that the -2 is not necessary when you know the turnIndex. Actually, you don't need really the turnIndex because you can compute it yourself. 
I like inputs (and statement) to be as concise as possible. For instance, id at the start and opponentAction at each turn would be enough to drive a bot. I have used only the actions and the grid description for debugging

I guess every game is a bit different like that. There's no problem with giving extra info. He also gives the boardstate and all the moves. That's not necessary either, but nice for beginners.

The important thing is that it is well described in the game description and also that it is bugfree.
Yeah, just my two cents. Guidelines bend towards more verbosity

Implemeted STEAL.

Second player can output STEAL or integer -2 in the second turn of the game.

Second player gets additional available move in inputs in the second turn for steal, integer -2.

It is shown in the viewer as expanding chip.

First player gets -2 as previousMove in that case.
The steal feature works OK for me

Nope it's not yet ok.

If you win on the last turn, then you don't win. The game ends as a draw before that. I just had a game where this happened.

https://imgur.com/a/02juhlQ

Look closely and you will see there is 1 empty spot left and blue was about to win, but never got the chance. 

I warned about this 5 posts down from my orinal post at the top :)

Almost there!

Better way to check draws: check if the top row is filled. Then you dont need to bother with the turnindex (after a win check of course!)

Fixed the bug :)

Everything seems to be ok now, though it is hard to test if the steal works correctly with draw/win/loss on the last turn.

 I rarely get a game that lasts that long. I'll trust you on this:)

I have two more little things you might want to change. Will make a new comment.

you didn't updated the edits on CG i think cause the bugs are not fixed yet and when i saw the code by downloading it its not the updated one

Update: Fixed it.

Actually, 6x7 is strongly solved which means the path to victory is known. There is nothing left to search except maybe implementing an algorithm that works in 50 ms. 

Seeing a "WIN in xx moves" at turn 0 is not very appealing.This is why I am suggesting a variant of Connect4. Of course, you are in the driver seat.
Agreed > 6x7. Will change it to 7x9.
7x9 fits in an uint64_t. You will make bitboarders happy
